newsitem.title: CZECH REPUBLIC: CZECH BANK CSOB PLANS $10 MLN UZBEK CREDIT LINE.
newsitem.headline: CZECH BANK CSOB PLANS $10 MLN UZBEK CREDIT LINE.

text.p: Czech Ceskoslovenska Obchodni Banka a.s. (CSOB) said on Thursday it signed a memorandum of intent to provide the Uzbek National Bank for Foreign Economic Activity a $10 million credit line for financing imports.

CSOB said in a statement the memorandum sets up talks on a three-year credit-line for Uzbek companies seeking buyers' credits for the purchase of Czech exports insured by the Czech Export Guarantee and Insurance Company (EGAP).
"CSOB is also ready to individualy consider financing of larger export contracts if insured by EGAP and guaranteed by the Uzbek Finance Ministry," the statement added.
The Czech Republic has run a trade deficit with Uzbekistan which reached $18.4 million in 1995 and $10.1 million in the first 11 months of 1996, according to the Czech Industry and Trade Ministry.
Czechs export mainly trams, busses and other transport equipment to Uzbekistan, while cotton accounts for 76 percent of Czech imports from the central Asian country.
The announcement came during the visit of a trade delegration travelling with Uzbek president Islam Karimov.
